item.title: Reuters first to report European regulators tell banks to prepare for Russian cyberattack threat
item.dc:creator: Erica Ascher
item.description:
Reuters was first to report that the European Central Bank (ECB) was preparing banks for a possible Russian-sponsored cyberattack as […]

The post Reuters first to report European regulators tell banks to prepare for Russian cyberattack threat appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters was first to report that the European Central Bank (ECB) was preparing banks for a possible Russian-sponsored cyberattack as tensions with Ukraine mount. The stand-off between Russia and Ukraine has rattled Europe’s political and business leaders, who fear an invasion that would inflict damage on the entire region. The report was confirmed the following day by Andrea Enria, the ECB’s top supervisor, who told a press conference that the ECB is telling euro zone banks to step up their defenses against cyberattacks.

The post Reuters first to report European regulators tell banks to prepare for Russian cyberattack threat appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters exclusively reports Konecranes, Cargotec to get EU okay for $5.1 billion deal; market reacts
item.dc:creator: Erica Ascher
item.description:
On Friday, Reuters exclusively reported that Finland’s Konecranes and Cargotec were set to take a step closer to creating a […]

The post Reuters exclusively reports Konecranes, Cargotec to get EU okay for $5.1 billion deal; market reacts appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
On Friday, Reuters exclusively reported that Finland’s Konecranes and Cargotec were set to take a step closer to creating a global leader in industrial machinery with conditional EU antitrust approval for their 4.5-billion-euro ($5.1 billion) tie-up. The companies, which provide road and sea-cargo handling machinery and services to industries, factories, ports and terminals, announced the deal in October last year but subsequently faced opposition from the European Commission. Konecranes and Cargotec last month offered to sell assets to address the EU competition enforcer’s concerns that the merger may curb competition and push up prices.

The post Reuters exclusively reports Konecranes, Cargotec to get EU okay for $5.1 billion deal; market reacts appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters first to report France’s Thales considers move for Atos cybersecurity arm BDS; market reacts
item.dc:creator: Erica Ascher
item.description:
Reuters was first to report that French defense group Thales is working on a plan to buy the cybersecurity business […]

The post Reuters first to report France’s Thales considers move for Atos cybersecurity arm BDS; market reacts appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters was first to report that French defense group Thales is working on a plan to buy the cybersecurity business of IT consultancy group Atos, as part of a $3 billion tie-up that would test the political determination for shoring up France’s digital defenses. Thales, which ranks as Europe’s largest defense electronics company, and its adviser Centerview Partners, have approached several private equity firms including Bain Capital to study a joint offer for Atos, which issued two profit warnings in seven months. Any deal involving buyout funds would likely trigger a break-up of Atos and raise political concern ahead of France’s presidential election in April.

The post Reuters first to report France’s Thales considers move for Atos cybersecurity arm BDS; market reacts appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals France’s Thales considers move for Atos cybersecurity arm BDS
item.dc:creator: Jaime-Lee Charles
item.description:
Reuters was first to report that French defense group Thales is working on a plan to buy the cybersecurity business of IT […]

The post Reuters reveals France’s Thales considers move for Atos cybersecurity arm BDS appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters was first to report that French defense group Thales is working on a plan to buy the cybersecurity business of IT consultancy group Atos, as part of a $3 billion tie-up that would test the political determination for shoring up France’s digital defenses. Thales, which ranks as Europe’s largest defense electronics company, and its adviser Centerview Partners, have approached several private equity firms, including Bain Capital, to study a joint offer for Atos, which issued two profit warnings in seven months. Any deal involving buyout funds would likely trigger a break-up of Atos and raise political concern ahead of France’s presidential election in April. Shares in Atos jumped 10% on the news, while Thales’ stock was down 3%.

The post Reuters reveals France’s Thales considers move for Atos cybersecurity arm BDS appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals U.S. SEC suspended internal watchdog for 7 days after misconduct finding
item.dc:creator: Jaime-Lee Charles
item.description:
Reuters exclusively reported that the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) suspended its inspector general Carl Hoecker for seven days without pay […]

The post Reuters reveals U.S. SEC suspended internal watchdog for 7 days after misconduct finding appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported that the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) suspended its inspector general Carl Hoecker for seven days without pay in 2020, despite an independent government committee recommending that the agency consider firing him for “serious misconduct.” The SEC documents provide new details on how the agency responded after a government investigation, first reported by Reuters in December, concluded that Hoecker abused his authority by conducting a “remarkably biased and flawed” internal probe into allegations against two of his employees.

The post Reuters reveals U.S. SEC suspended internal watchdog for 7 days after misconduct finding appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals Aeromexico may still hit bumps after bankruptcy exit
item.dc:creator: Jaime-Lee Charles
item.description:
Reuters provided insight into how Aeromexico looks set to emerge from bankruptcy within days, but analysts believe the Mexican airline faces stiff […]

The post Reuters reveals Aeromexico may still hit bumps after bankruptcy exit appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters provided insight into how Aeromexico looks set to emerge from bankruptcy within days, but analysts believe the Mexican airline faces stiff challenges taking on low-cost competitors like Volaris, now the country’s busiest airline. Aeromexico, which filed for bankruptcy in June 2020 as demand cratered in the first months of the pandemic, won final court approval for a restructuring plan that aims to reduce its debt from $2 billion to more than $1 billion. But even after slashing its debt load and operating costs under Chapter 11 protection, Aeromexico may struggle to claw back ground lost to low-cost carriers.

The post Reuters reveals Aeromexico may still hit bumps after bankruptcy exit appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters exclusively reports Canada’s Nutrien eyes potash production boost amid turmoil in Russia, Belarus; market reacts
item.dc:creator: Erica Ascher
item.description:
Reuters exclusively reported that the world’s biggest potash miner could boost production by up to 29% in the coming years, […]

The post Reuters exclusively reports Canada’s Nutrien eyes potash production boost amid turmoil in Russia, Belarus; market reacts appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported that the world’s biggest potash miner could boost production by up to 29% in the coming years, depending on any sanctions facing rival producers in Russia and Belarus. Prices of granular potash fertilizer are near 10-year highs in the United States and Brazil, helped by Western economic sanctions against Belarus. Russia, home of Uralkali and EuroChem potash mines, faces possible economic sanctions if it invades Ukraine. Uralkali and Belarus Potash Company (BPC) together account for more than one-third of global potash sales, according to BMO Capital Markets.

The post Reuters exclusively reports Canada’s Nutrien eyes potash production boost amid turmoil in Russia, Belarus; market reacts appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters ahead with Boeing and Qatar Airways airplane deals; market reacts
item.dc:creator: Erica Ascher
item.description:
Reuters was ahead with details of two major Boeing deals signed by Qatar Airways on Jan 31. On Jan. 25, […]

The post Reuters ahead with Boeing and Qatar Airways airplane deals; market reacts appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters was ahead with details of two major Boeing deals signed by Qatar Airways on Jan 31. On Jan. 25, Reuters was first to report advanced talks to help Boeing launch a new 777X freighter, including the quantity of 34 airplanes. On Jan. 31, Reuters broke the news that the deal, to be signed at the White House that day, would also include a surprise $7 billion order for 737 MAX passenger jets from the same airline. Reuters has been consistently ahead with news on a new freighter since June 2021, revealing that Boeing was offering the proposed 777X cargo plane.

The post Reuters ahead with Boeing and Qatar Airways airplane deals; market reacts appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals Qatar seeks guarantees that emergency gas stays within EU
item.dc:creator: Jaime-Lee Charles
item.description:
Reuters broke the news that top gas producer Qatar is asking the European Union to restrict resales of gas outside the bloc […]

The post Reuters reveals Qatar seeks guarantees that emergency gas stays within EU appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters broke the news that top gas producer Qatar is asking the European Union to restrict resales of gas outside the bloc if it wants Qatar and other major gas suppliers to provide emergency supply in case of a Russia-Ukraine conflict. Qatar has also requested an EU resolution to a 2018 probe into its long-term contracts, which the European Commission had said might be inhibiting the free flows of gas in Europe and its single gas market. The requests made by Qatar go to the core of the EU’s gas market liberalization. The EU sees totally free trade of gas as essential to energy security, but major producers and some gas consumers say the reforms of the past two decades have often wreaked havoc and led to higher prices.

The post Reuters reveals Qatar seeks guarantees that emergency gas stays within EU appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals China securities regulator met foreign banks to soothe economic concerns
item.dc:creator: Jaime-Lee Charles
item.description:
Reuters exclusively reported that the China Securities and Regulatory Commission (CSRC) met with executives at top western banks and asset managers to […]

The post Reuters reveals China securities regulator met foreign banks to soothe economic concerns appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported that the China Securities and Regulatory Commission (CSRC) met with executives at top western banks and asset managers to reassure them about the country’s economic prospects after regulatory crackdowns in 2021. Senior executives from firms including BlackRock, Credit Suisse, Fidelity International, Goldman Sachs, JP Morgan, Morgan Stanley and UBS attended the meeting. CSRC Vice Chairman Fang Xinghai reassured the meeting participants that China will achieve “respectable growth” in 2022.  

The post Reuters reveals China securities regulator met foreign banks to soothe economic concerns appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
